com.aaronmreyes.scrabble.core

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aaronmreyes.scrabble.core.Game

  • public final class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class which contains all methods needed by the GUI to react to changes in the game state. Contains its own instances of a Board and list of Players
    Author:
    Aaron Reyes

        public java.util.List<Player> checkForWin()
        The method to check for a winning player.
        Returns:
        null if no player found or the Player/Players who won

      • placeTileOnBoard

        public void placeTileOnBoard()
        the method to take the current player's selected hand tile and adds it to their list of moves made this turn while removing this tile from their hand. If the player's is invalid, the move is undone and the selected tile is returned to the player's hand. NOTE: does not actually place on Board.

      • removeTilefromBoard

        public void removeTilefromBoard()
        The method used when a player wants to undo the last move they made. Does nothing if their is no last move to undo.

      • mixHand

        public void mixHand()
        The method to mix the tiles in the current Player's hand.

      • updateHandTile

        public void updateHandTile(int index)
        The method which updates which hand tile the current player has selected to use.
        Parameters:
        index - - the index of the tile in the hand of the current player

      • updateBoardTile

        public void updateBoardTile(int row,
                   int col)
        The method used to update the board tile selected by the current player for use in their move.
        Parameters:
        row - - The row of the tile selected on the board
        col - - the column of the tile selected on the board

      • playWord

        public void playWord()
        The method used by the current player to take their move-set and place these moves on the board. If the move is invalid (does not match a word in the dictionary.txt) then the move is undone and all tiles used in the move are returned to the current player's hand. If the move was valid, then tiles are drawn from the letterBank until the player has the 7 number of tiles in their hand. If there are no more tiles left in the letterBank, then the player doesn't get anymore cards into their hand. Lastly, this method clears the current player's moves list.

      • addExchangeTile

        public void addExchangeTile(int index)
        This method is used when a player wishes to take a given tile in their hand and add it to the list of exchanged tiles. Does not remove tile from the player's hand.
        Parameters:
        index - - The index of the tile in the player's hand to add to the list

      • removeExchangeTile

        public void removeExchangeTile(int index)
        This method is used when the current player wishes to remove a certain tile from the list of exchanged tiles.
        Parameters:
        index - - the index of the tile in the player's hand to remove.

      • exchangeTiles

        public void exchangeTiles()
        This method is used when the player is done adding tiles to be exchanged and wishes to exchange all selected tiles with the letterBank. If the letterBank is empty, then all selected tiles are just returned to the current player's hand. Lastly, this method clears the exchanges list upon exit.

      • undoMove

        public void undoMove()
        A simple method used by the GUI to undo an invalid move

        public AbstractTile[][] getBoard()
        Getter method to get the current board.
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getNumTilesLeft

        public int getNumTilesLeft()
        getter method to get the length of the LetterBank list.
        Returns:
        the return value of Board.getLetterBankTotal()

      • getCurrentPlayer

        getter method to get the current player making their move.
        Returns:
